entry.title: Welcome SPRING with a sweet bang!
entry.summary:
Winter is on its way out and Candy Funhouse is bringing in SPRING with a sweet bang! Have you tried these special sweet and salty munchie treats yet? Go ahead, check 'em out:

More
entry.content:
Winter is on its way out and Candy Funhouse is bringing in Spring with a sweet bang! Have you tried these tasty sweet treats yet? 

Oh yes, Winter has been a long one, and through these challenging Canadian c-cc-cold winters we sure can use some sweet pick-me-up's! Good news: Spring is finally here! How are you going to celebrate? 

Spring means Easter time chocolate egg FUN!

Candy Funhouse has the largest selection of Easter chocolate eggs in Canada – not just to celebrate Easter, of course, but to bring in Spring with a tasty treat! You deserve it, your family deserves it, and it makes for a heck of a lot of fun too, since they have a special timeless toy inside! Check out the Reese Easter Egg ('cause everyone loves its peanut-butter goodness!), Cadbury's Oreo Egg (it's soo yummy and gooey good inside!), and let's not forget the ones you can hide everywhere: These Kit Kat Hide Me Eggs that are individually wrapped and DELICIOUSLY tasting! 

Candy Funhouse also carries the Disney Minnie Mouse Chocolate Eggs for Mickey + Minnie fans, NHL Chocolate eggs for the sports fanatic, Barbie, Unicorn, Frozen, Kung-Fu Panda, Regal Academy, Toy Story, and sooo many more including the traditional Kinder Surprise! Check 'em out [HERE] and order your selection of candy and chocolate online today!

Have a crunchy snack while you're gardening!

We know that tons of Candy Funhouse customers are gardening green thumbs who are itching to get going on the garden – if that's you, don't forget to check out Candy Funhouse's huge selection of crunchy munchie snacks that'll keep your hunger at bay while you finish planting those seedlings! 

Select from Candy Funhouse's huge munchie options of snacks online, like the Pringles variety of Scorchin' hot Cheddar and BBQ varieties, Wavy Fire Roasted Jalapeño and Applewood Smoked Pringles, or Screamin' Dill Pickle! There are so many varieties you can combine and create your own flavour combos!

See the Pringle varieties [HERE]. 

Special Springtime Game Snacks - make 'em CHEETOS!

There's of course a TON of sweet + salty crunchy munchies that Candy Funhouse has online for you to order now that you'll be spending more time outdoors and will most definitely need a snacky-munchie-salty treat to fill that gap between meals.

Why not try the AMAZING new Cheetos Pop Crunch Mix that is so savoury, crunchy and cheese all rolled into one! 

Nestle's Bruncha Crunch Theatre Pack packs a punch of goodness without the high calories! At only 180 calories per serving, they'll have you sweetly munching on bunches of delicious milk chocolate filled with crispy rice bits.  Too good to pass up!

Maybe you feel like having a hot crunchy snack alongside a cold one? These Cheetos Xxtra Flamin' Hot Crunchy snacks will challenge your tastebuds with a super hot cheese taste that is typical of Cheetos! Go ahead... Candy Funhouse challenges you to order them online today!

Spring means SWEETS!

So you're in the mood for something sweet after a long day of walking outdoors in the most amazing Springtime weather, right? Our team at Candy Funhouse loves these Snickers Crunchy Peanut Butter Squared bars, the MegaLoad Caramel Crunch with its king size goodness, these incredible Violet Crumble Candy Bars from Australia ("it's the way it shatters that matters!"), and back from the 1990's it's the amazing Twix Cookies & Creme, because it's already been 30 years and we need more!

Springtime Mix – It's Spring after all!

If in doubt, order all your candies, chocolates, chips and snack assortments through Candy Funhouse because you will not see these at your supermarket! And since it's spring and we need to celebrate, don't forget these Dove Dark Chocolate Caramel Assortment Springtime Mix! Taste the silky smooth Dove dark chocolate with a sweet & salty springtime twist from sea salt caramel filling. It's just the thing you've been waiting for to celebrate spring!
.
Any reason is a good reason to celebrate spring, we've been going through so much and waiting for so long, now's the time to get outside and then celebrate with a TREAT! At Candy Funhouse we feel we deserve it... don't you?

entry.title: Top 10 new candy you must try!
entry.summary:
Candy Funhouse has searched the world to find all the newest candy creations for you. Check out our Top 10 new candies you MUST TRY!

More
entry.content:
Candy Funhouse searched the world to find all the newest candy creations, and here's the Top 10 you must try this year!

At Candy Funhouse, we know you like to order your favourite candies and treats online, but there are always new creations coming up for sale online through our site, and this year it's no exception! There are so many goodies that are just too good to pass up and not try out. These selections will make you the most popular one at school, work, and even at home!

In no particular order of preference, here are the Top 10 we selected to share with you, our MUST TRY bunch of sweets!

1. Oreo Lady Gaga Cookies – Limited Edition Release

Inspired by Lady Gaga's latest album, Chromatica, Oreo has done it again with their newest creation: Oreo Lady Gaga Cookies! Each Oreo is coloured pink with a neon green cream centre that tastes just like the original Oreo cookie, except for the vibrant neon green colour! This cookie will have you singing verses as you dip them in a cold delicious glass of milk. Just so YUM! 

2. Sweetbox Collectables Candy Toys

In a world where candy and toys are matched so perfectly for hours of sweet fun and play, Sweetbox has done it again with these collectables that include a toy and fruit gummies to enjoy.  Choose from Kitty Cat, Space Pony, and Fluffies the Dog... or get all three and start your collection!

3. Office Stapler Gummy

Inspired by Jim from NBC's The Office "Pilot" episode, this 'stapler' is stuffed inside a candy jello-wanna-be (a delicious gummy!), this one makes a great gift for anyone who has ever seen The Office, or even as a gag gift for April Fool's Day! 

4. Jelly Belly Rosé Mini 'Wine' Bottles

Celebrate the day's end with a glass of bubbly Jelly Belly beans, all tucked away in this perfect little bottle that reminds you of moments worth celebrating! The non-alcoholic sweet pink beans are gluten/peanut/dairy/fat free, and vegetarian friendly! How fun are these?

5. Doritos 3D Crunch Chili Cheese Nacho

Welcome to the long-awaited return of the 3D Crunch Chili Cheese Nacho chip! These three-dimensional shaped Doritos are puffed up with a hollow centre and a hearty chili cheese nacho flavour that is too good not to try. As must online order from Candy Funhouse today!

6. Mars Chocolate Spread

Calling all chocolate lovers! Imported from Germany, this new choco spread by Mars is out of this world! Made with natural chocolate and milk, it's complemented by delicious caramel and tastes just like you're eating a real Mars bar. Spread it on toast, cakes, or even a crunchy apple.

7. Ritz Cheese Crispers

Here's something for those with the munchies who are craving something crunchy and cheesie-licious! These oven-baked potato and wheat chips are made with real cheese; available in Cheddar Cheese flavour, or Four Cheese & Herb with a nice light taste and full crunch.

 

8. Jelly Belly Mint Chocolate Truffles

Here's a new and innovative candy from Jelly Belly that's just so deserving of new attention! These special edition Mint Chocolate Truffles from Jelly Belly are a classic combination of chocolate and mint: A delicious chocolate filled with the just the right amount of mint that pops in your mouth with flavour. A must try for Candy Funhouse's new 2021 collection!

9. GoLightly Sugar-free

Choose from GoLightly Sugar Free assorted fruit chews, vanilla caramels or Starlight Mints, these are sure to become favourites! They are a sweetened with sugar alcohols and Splenda for a sugar-free choice. Check out the varieties and order one... or all!

10. Ganong Chicken Bones Bites

This is an oldie but super-goodie! The original Chicken Bones, a popular candy in Atlantic Canada since the late 19th century, has made a comeback; a spicy cinnamon flavoured candy with the bittersweet chocolate flavour that is luscious and an explosion for the taste buds! 

Candy Funhouse has a huge collection of new candies you can order online for quick delivery of the freshest candies, chocolates, treats and munchies. For more of what you really "must try" this year, check out the whole new collection we have in store for you [HERE]! You won't be disappointed!

Which one of these do you want to try first? Share your comments below!

entry.title: March Break: Let's Make it Happen!
entry.summary:
March Break is coming up and it's a great time to spend some quality time with the family. Here are some ideas on how to make it even more special – even while staying safely at home!

More
entry.content:
How to make March Break happen? Order candy online for special delivery from Candy Funhouse, of course!

March Break is coming up and it's a great time to spend some quality time with the family. Candy Funhouse shares some ideas on how to make it even more special – even while staying safely at home!

 

MARCH BREAK IS COMING!

Times may have changed, but people have not. After working so hard we all need a vacation, even if that means a Staycation! Time off work, time to catch up on some Netflix, maybe dust off the winter blues and start thinking of springtime ahead... with candy by your side!

Here are some ways to make March Break happen for the whole family:

  1. Game night. Every night!  Schedule a game night with your family, and make your games revolve around candy. Our Candy Funhouse team put together this candy game blog [HERE] with lots of sweet ideas to tie in with. Everyone loves a good game night, schedule it in!


  2. March Break around the world. Pick a country or region and dress up with that theme... One country per day = 7 days of fun! Make your candy online purchase selection match the different countries you're picking. For example, on "Mexican Day" you can have a taco dinner night, then Doritos 3D Crunch Chili Cheese Nacho Chips while watching a Mexican film, followed by efrutti Mexican Dinner gummies!  Candy Funhouse has online candy sales from Japan, British candy, Australian candy, and of course our very own Canadian candy - and this is cause for celebration!


  3. Celebrate Spring. March 20th is the first day of spring, so why not celebrate it early and get the family going on springtime fun-time? You can get the smaller kiddoes planting some seeds and for every seed they plant they get a special treat! On another day, take the kids on a drive to look at some of the early blooms surrounding the neighbourhood, like daffodils, crocuses and tulips - then they can match the colours they see with a colourful candy! Here are some favourites, including Australia's Lifesaver Fruit Tingles, Skittles Tropical candies, Jelly Belly Kids Mix, or even Bigs Cheese Burger sunflower seeds, which they'll love!



  4. Gift them a March Break Gift Set! When all else fails, make family, neighbours and friends feel special by ordering them a gift basket online! Candy Funhouse has a variety of sweet gift baskets for any taste, like the Disney Frozen 2 Gift Basket for smaller children, PEZ Star Wars Mandalorian Twin Pack gift set for the Star Wars aficionado, and even the delicious Amish Country Popcorn Gift Set, perfect for any family movie night!


Sometimes all it takes is one person in the family to make a difference. Be the person in your family that makes March Break happen - plan ahead, order your candy online through Candy Funhouse now so that each person in your family will receive their unique sweet package of goodies to celebrate March Break and make it memorable!

What are you doing this March Break? Share with us your ideas for making it memorable! Comment below:

entry.title: It's never too soon to show your LOVE!
entry.summary:
At Candy Funhouse we're big on showing you care, and we think we should celebrate Valentine's Day all year through, with kindness, compassion, love, and TONS OF CANDY!

More
entry.content:
At Candy Funhouse, we are BIG on LOVE!  Although Valentine’s Day is February 14th, we like to think we can celebrate love and kindness all year round – especially this coming year! 

There are many reasons why we celebrate Valentine’s Day – it’s tradition, it’s history, it’s exciting, it’s a whole month of celebrating those you love!

You don’t have to limit your Valentine’s Day celebrations to just a ‘special someone’. Many people may not have a significant other, they may choose to live the single lifestyle – and we think that is just swell as long as that’s what makes you happy!

You can order some candy online from Candy Funhouse, just because it’s the BEST way to get it: By mail! Imagine looking in your mailbox and seeing that your online candy order has arrived? Woo-hoo!

These past few months have been a challenge for all of us, plus it’s Winter so it’s not always to visit family and friends. Let them know you are thinking about them and order some candy, treats, and chocolates online now so they get it way before Valentine’s Day arrives! Beat the rush, surprise them NOW!

Retro online candy for your parents:

Candy Funhouse’s extensive collection of vintage and nostalgic (retro!) candy will remind them of their youth, of what their parents would bring home for them, of times past… And this is always a nice feeling, right? Here are some ideas for those aged 45+ that you’d want to surprise for Valentine’s Day, including

  • Butter Rum flavoured Lifesaver Candies
  • Cracker Jacks candy popcorn
  • Candy Cigarettes
  • Beemans Chewing Gum

 

Valentine’s Day Candy Online order for your kiddos:

It depends on their age, of course, but there are just so many varieties of candies you can order online for your children - no matter what they like! There are favourite candies with toys, candies for the Star Wars fan or sports fan, collectors editions, Japanese candies for the Manga aficionados, Barbie themed… We have just so many candy ideas that you can choose from to buy candy online right here in Canada - like these:

  • Jelly Belly Star Wars Tin or Sports Beans in orange flavour
  • Kidsmania collection of child-focused candies with toys and themes
  • Barbie Laser Pop Lollipop

For your significant other – or just for you!

For Valentine’s Day, we suggest anything RED and CHOCOLATE. At Candy Funhouse you can order an unimaginable variety of chocolates and candy, whether dark, milk or white chocolate, flavoured chocolate, candied chocolate, fudge, mint chocolate, chocolate cookies, sugar free chocolate, chocolate with nuts, you name it - we have it for you to order online!

Click on [THIS LINK] to check out our IMMENSE chocolate collection! Who doesn’t like chocolate? And it’s never too soon to order your Valentine’s Day gift collection ideas!

Valentine’s Day is a good opportunity to show you care – and also to treat yourself! Why not order your candy collection from Candy Funhouse now, so you can start planning for a fantastically sweet V-Day MONTH!

Which is your favourite candy to receive for Valentine’s Day? Share in the comments below; we’d love to get your opinion!

entry.title: BEST Stocking Stuffer Ideas
entry.summary:
At Candy Funhouse, we're all about making those around you happy – and what better way than celebrating Christmas with awesome Candy Stocking Stuffers! Here are some candy - and non-candy - ideas for your last-minute shopping.

More
entry.content:
It’s that time of year, and what a year it has been! At Candy Funhouse we’re all about making those around you happy – and what better way than celebrating Christmas with candy!

Whether you started your Christmas shopping early at your local retailers, or if you finished ordering your gifts online, Christmas is never quite complete without the traditional stocking stuffers.

Christmas stockings have been around for centuries, and they’re the “bonus” that many kids – and adults! – look for on Christmas morning. Customs vary from country to country, for example, in many Asian countries it is still customary to give your friends and loved ones apples, which have been lovingly and creatively decorated and wrapped in pretty, colourful paper. Love that! And in Mexico, the Christmas piñata is still practised, with toys and candies abound.

We still prefer the stocking, and filling it can seem like a challenge… Until you check out Candy Funhouse’s Best Stocking Stuffer ideas for Christmas! Here are the top 12 ideas for what to put in your stockings this year:

 

1. Cosmetics

Not just for teens, but for moms and dads too! A specialty shaving kit for dad, a fancy night cream for mom, a new special sparkly nail polish for sis, and how about a fun little soap set for the toddler?

2. Socks, of course!

A stocking wouldn’t be quite the same without some new fun socks! Wrap them separately and make them UNmatchable… Because, who says socks have to match? Give each one of your kids a sock that doesn’t match, and let them figure it out!

3. Favourite fruit

Add their favourite fruit – like a mango, a passion fruit, kiwi, or something different from abroad they may never have tried, like a lychee fruit, a pomegranate, or a star fruit. It’ll make for fun conversation too! Fruit has been stuffed into a Christmas stocking for AGES, why stop now?

4. Jewelry

It doesn’t have to be fancy, but even the smallest token of jewelry makes everyone smile! Like a button pin, different kind of earrings they’d never buy for themselves, cufflinks for the guys, or a cute little pendant.

5. Hair stuff

We all need these, and we all run out of these – especially if you like doing ‘stuff’ with your hair! How about a new hairbrush, clips, and new fancy hair elastics?

6. Cards

That’s “playing cards” for you! There are tons that are even sold at the local dollar store with different pictures on them, from Barbie to My Little Pony, Star Wars to the all-popular Yoda.

7. Eco items

With the eco-craze going on right now, and since we’re all trying to avoid plastics, how about adding some paper straws to your stockings? There’s also traveling cutlery sets, and reusable collapsible cups. Help out Mother Earth this Christmas too!

8. Pet items

They probably won’t get their own stocking, so why not add one item per stocking for each of the family members? This way, they can give it to Spot or Fluffy themselves: Like a specialty dog biscuit, a dog brush, or a new cat toy.

9. Toothbrush

This one deserves its own mention, as we really should be changing our toothbrush more often folks! Christmas time is the perfect time to invest in a new toothbrush for each family member. Goodbye germs, hello sparkly teeth!

10. A new subscription

There are so many great magazines being published out there, and something for everyone! Get them a copy of it, roll it up, and subscribe them to the latest online edition! We all need less time on our iPhones, and more time off to unplug. Plus, a subscription is the gift that keeps on giving year 'round!

11. Handmade IOUs

This is one of our favourites, because it’s made by YOU! Create a little set of “IOUs” that they can redeem on a once-per-month basis: Redeem for a kitchen chore, a bathroom cleanup, raking the garden, or even for a kiss! The possibilities are endless, and these IOUs can make for the best gifts of all. Get creative! You know what they’ll love! Whether working IOUs, romantic IOUs, funny IOUs, they're such a lovely gift to receive (and fun to make!).

12. Candy: OUR FAVOURITE!

Of course we had to make this our BEST Christmas stocking stuffer idea of all time! Here are some of our favourites for this year:

 

PEZ Star Wars Mandalorian Twin Pack Gift Set

They’ll go crazy over it this year! It’s hot, it’s IN, and it’s SWEET!

Coal Mine Gum Bag

Bring back the laughter with a blast from the past! These retro bubble gums are juicy, flavourful, and so fun!

Oreo Gingerbread Cookies

Perfect for the Holidays… and they’re sooo good!

Disney Mickey Mouse Christmas Surprise Eggs

Who doesn’t love Mickey? Made in Italy, with a specialty toy inside.

M&Ms White Chocolate Cheesecake

What? Did someone say “cheesecake”? YESSS! Quick, gift one to everyone in your family this Christmas!

PEZ dispensers

Collect them all! Or give one to each child and family member. They are collectibles, you know?

 

Terry’s Chocolate Orange

This is a classic, and one which you can even hide in between branches of the tree!

Needless to say, stockings may not be in your tradition, and they may not even be something you fancy, and that’s okay too! There is always a different kind of sweet treat you can give that special someone. Like this GIANT Kisses milk chocolate candy!

 

At Candy Funhouse, we have the best collection of Christmas candy, candy canes, specialty chocolates, gifts and more to make this a super sweet and super special Christmas. Order online now so you can be done with your Holiday shopping, and on to wrapping!

Merry Christmas everyone!

Which Christmas specialty candy would YOU like to see in your stocking this year? Leave us a comment below:

- - - -

#holidayshopping #stockingstuffers #giftIdeas #ChristmasShopping #ShopOnline #candyOnline #CandyFunhouse #beststockingstuffers #stockingideas #buyCandyOnline

entry.title: Spookylicious Sweets for Halloween
entry.content:
If there is such a thing as a best time of year for candy, it’s Halloween! We all have great memories about trick or treating, and especially about going home and dumping the stash we collected on the table to sort out... and start devouring!

Some of us remember sorting out candy by name, by colour, or by type – chocolates together, lollipops in one pile, and gum in another. And do you remember making it a competition with your siblings to see who got the most candy? Our team at Candy Funhouse sure does!

Halloween is not a time to think about giving something ‘healthy’ like raisins… Oh no no! It’s all about candy! And if you want to be the HOT SHOT of the neighbourhood, you need to plan ahead and order your stash online, this way the kids will be talking about how you got the best treats to go around! It’s such a nice time of year to see all the kids’ costumes and share in the happiness. Plus, us parents also get to pick and choose some favourites!

No matter what you love most about Halloween, candy is king! There are so many favourites this year; check out Candy Funhouse’s Top 10 spookylicious sweet treats for this year:

1. Nestle Halloween Assorted Candy Bars:

This massive bag has 45 pieces of your favourite candy bars, including Baby Ruth, 100 Grand, Butterfinger, and Crunch. All good, all the time, and perfect to fit in lunch boxes every day ’til they’re gone.

 

2. Oreo Chocolate Candy Bars:

Just in time for Halloween! These fun size bars are perfect for giving out to trick or treaters, or just to enjoy at home! They are so yummy, with two pieces of sweet Oreo staple chocolate crunch and a delicious filling that you must try!

3. UTZ Halloween Bats and Jacks: 

These fun-shaped pretzel snacks will leave you giggling every time you take a bite! UTZ has done it again! With 70 baggies of crunchy goodness that are made in a peanut and tree nut-free facility.

 

 

 

 

 

 

4. Toxic Waste Halloween Sour Candy:

A fun assortment of sour candies combined with stickers, in this awesome bank that you can use to save up your change with after – maybe to buy more candy with later?  This “Hazardously Sour Candy” will make your face pucker and feet quiver! Double-action sour candy that is super super sour, and turning into a sweet candy taste on the inside. A must for this year’s Halloween-lovin’ kid!

 

 

 

 

5. UTZ Halloween Mini Cheese Balls:

Did someone say cheese? Enjoy breaking the sweetness of Halloween candy with a cheese ball or two! (Then you can go back to having some more candy!). This fun tub has 60 bags of Mini Cheese Balls (25 oz each). Another Candy Funhouse favourite!

 

 

 

 

 

6. Ring Pop Halloween:

Candy Funhouse has put together the best trick-or-treating bag for you right here, with an assortment of Ring Pop flavours in a fun Halloween bag! This 22 count bag of Ring Pops includes all your favourite flavours – order yours today!

 

7. PEZ Halloween:

Only have a few kids coming to your door, or you have some special neighbourhood kids to gift something to? Maybe you’re a PEZ Candy Collector? Check out these fun Halloween-themed Pez dispensers, including Smiling Pumpkin, Witch, Vampire, Ghost, and Glowing Pumpkin. Order all 5 today! 

 

8. Vidal Bulging Eyeballs:

These spookylicious gummy eyeballs will have your Halloween guests screaming for more fun treats! They’re perfect for when you have some neighbours or friends coming to say ‘Trick or Treat’ – how many eyeballs can you fit in your mouth? They’re peanut free, gluten free, fat free, and super gooey good!

 

 

 

 

 

9. eFrutti Gummi Bracelet Candy:

Take ‘bling’ to a whole new sweet level with these yummy gummy candy bracelets. Comes in six flavours, including strawberry, mango, apple, blueberry, orange, and raspberry. Each is individually wrapped and you can order as many as you want – can’t you just taste them already? Sweet!

 

 

10. Milk Chocolate Loonies:

Money for Halloween? YES, Money is always the theme! These milk chocolate loonies are made with great tasting chocolate, the kids will be fighting to see who collected more ‘money’! Always a good addition to any loot bag or themed party – who doesn’t love to receive some sweet money? Candy Funhouse’s bag has 180 loonies… and that’s all you’ll need to complete your Halloween Candy Online Shopping... Plus they make an awesome gift for anyone abroad!

Whatever your preference for Halloween, Candy Funhouse is here to help with all your online candy order – Get it just in time for Halloween!

We'd love to hear from you: Which was your favourite candy to get for Halloween? Comment below!

entry.title: Safest Candies for Kids
entry.content:
It’s no secret: Kids love candy, and if you’re having a candy buffet party or it’s their birthday and you want to celebrate by ordering some specialty candy online, it’s sometimes difficult to know what is best to get for them!

We especially worry about those kiddos with allergies! Of course, every small child should be monitored constantly to make sure they’re putting the safest goodies in their mouths, and candies are no exception. We got you parents!! And we’re sharing our safest candies for kids with you, so you can have some peace of mind! 

 

Allergens in candies

There are some candies that pose a threat to children with allergies, as they may contain the recognized “top 8 allergens”. Those allergens can include milk, peanuts, tree nuts, wheat or gluten in general, soybean, fish, shellfish and eggs. These food allergens must legally be clearly declared on any candy label, as they account for 90% of all food allergens.

The safest candies that have no allergens include:

  • Skittles – These flavours are safe from the top 8 allergens: Original, sour, wild berry, tropical, orchards, and Desserts flavours.
  • Sour Patch Kids – No top 8 allergens here either! This includes the lime, lemon, orange, berry and raspberry flavours. Hurray!
  • Starburst – At Mars, they ensure a comprehensive allergen management program, and so these favourites are included in the no-allergen list, for strawberry, lemon, orange and lime flavours. Thank you Mars!
  • Smarties – Made in a peanut-free facility, these yummy-sized, kid-friendly candies are free from the top 8 allergens as well as sesame. If the UPC starts with 011206 you can rest assured that it’s made in a peanut-free facility!
  • Swedish Fish – Not only are they free from the top 8 allergens, but also free from sesame or mustard! Now you can rest assured those fishies are swimming safely in your mouth!
  • Dots, Original and Tropical Sour  – Free from the top 8 allergens, including peanut, tree nut, wheat/gluten
  • Ring Pops – Free from the top 8 allergens, as well as sesame. This goes for all flavours, so put a ring on it and love ‘em up!

 

Vegan and vegetarian safe candies:

It’s no secret that vegans and vegetarians love to eat as much as the next person, and candies are no exception!

There are some candies which aren’t suitable for vegans as they may be made using ingredients such as gelatin, carmine, lard, confectioners glaze, bone char, milk, eggs, or honey. The following are amazingly enjoyable candies which you CAN have, if you’re vegan or vegetarian, as they do not contain any of these top 8 allergens:

  • Airheads Taffy
  • Dots
  • Dum Dums
  • Ferrara Atomic FireBalls
  • Ferrara Chocolate Wafer Swirls
  • Cry Baby Candy
  • Fruit by the Foot
  • Haribo Sour S’ghetti Gummi Candy
  • Hubba Bubba Gum
  • Jolly Rancher Lollipops
  • Joyva Chocolate Covered Orange and also Raspberry Ring Jells
  • Jujubes
  • Jujyfruits
  • Lemonheads
  • Mary Jane Candy
  • Sour Patch Kids
  • Skittles
  • Smarties
  • Sweet Tarts
  • Tic Tac Mints
  • Twizzlers
  • Velamints
  • Zots

 

Safest candies for small children:

Although enjoying candies on a regular basis is probably not the best thing for small toddlers, if they are over 2 years old you can give them the occasional treat – as long as it’s kid-safe, allergen-free, and not a choking hazard! Never give your small child any hard candies, at least until they turn 4 years old – and even then, monitor them while they’re tasting it, and learning how to eat it! So basically that means, sitting down to eat it… not ever running around with candy in their mouths!

Also unsafe for little ones are things like candy corn, pumpkin or sesame seeds, and gummy candy, taffy and caramel, because they can easily slip down their throat, causing them to choke. 

So what is safest? Soft candies are probably the safest you can occasionally give your toddler to enjoy. Goodies like cotton candy, milk chocolate bars, peanut butter cups, and chocolate-covered peppermint patties are pretty safe, as long as they’re pre-cut in tiny pieces, and you’re cleared for any allergic reactions to the top 8 allergens mentioned above, like peanuts/nuts, dairy, gluten, and eggs. Always let your kids taste it WITH YOU, never alone or unattended!

The relationship kids will develop with candy can be a sweet and rewarding one, and there is a candy for everyone’s tastes, and even cultures! Check out the extensive candy collections we have at Candy Funhouse, and start picking some of your children's favourites for their next party! Make theirs a memorable one –make it something they’ll remember fondly for years to come!

Which candies do you remember having as a child? Candy Funhouse wants to know!

- - - -

entry.title: Make Back To School Sweet
entry.summary:
Stacks of lined paper, and bright yellow pencils, brand new shoes and backpacks, and maybe some whining kids that are not that eager for school to begin – unless you pack some special candy for them!

More
entry.content:
Our Favourite Back to School Candy

Stacks of lined paper, and bright yellow pencils, brand new shoes and backpacks... Back to desks and dusty chalkboards, and more than likely, some whining kids that are not that eager for school to begin!

Help to ease those end-of-summertime blues, and send them back to school smiling!  We've got some great candy for those little sweeties that just might give them the extra encouragement they need for the back to school season. 

Here are some of Candy Funhouse's favourite back to school must have candies:

 

1. Smarties Candy

Did you know that Smarties originally came with letters on them in order to help kids learn the alphabet? Smarties are always a hit! Young and old alike, perfect for sharing with classmates or becoming the teacher's pet! A Retro Candy that you probably ate as a kid, these brightly-coloured chocolate candies have been around since the 1970s. Whether you "suck them very slowly or crunch them very fast ", Smarties are a back to school staple!


2. Kidsmania Skool Bus filled with Candy

School trips will never be the same, send them off with this cute yellow "skool" bus that's jam-packed with delicious brightly-coloured candy! Not only is this candy fun to eat, but the yellow school bus also doubles as a toy! Makes the perfect lunch bag treat and a quiet bus ride!

 

3. Nerds Candy

We know it's cool to be a nerd, so why not eat them? Tiny, crunchy tangy bits of sugary fruity goodness. Nerds Candy may be small but pack big flavour! Nerds are a Retro Candy that we've been crunching since 1983. Nerds come in a wide variety of flavours, each pack contains a separate flavour compartment so you don't have all the pressure of picking a favourite. After all, being a Nerd is hard enough!

 

4. Razzles

"First it's a candy, then it's a gum" – Razzles are truly transformational! Starting off as a delicious candy and then turning into an even tastier gum, Razzles are two treats in one package! Razzles has been around since the 1960s. That's what at Candy Funhouse we like to call an "Old School Candy"!

 

5. Airheads Taffy Candy

A tangy, chewy, tasty taffy that's filled with the most intense fruity flavours, Airheads also come in a mystery flavour so you can always keep them guessing! Airheads are always a hit with the kids and the perfect size for a little back to school recess treat.

We've been sinking our teeth into this taffy since the early 1980s! Airheads Taffy Candy are a classic Retro Candy that we still love to eat. We don't want you to be an "Air Head", just eat them!


6. Ring Pop

Ring Pop are the sweetest bling around! A sweet gem shaped like a wearable ring makes it fashionable to eat this candy! Easy to take a little taste while you're sitting at your desk or a perfect homework snack that won't get in the way of reading! Ring Pop are a cool Retro Candy that have graced our fingers since 1977!


7. Bean Boozled Jelly Beans

Jelly Beans that double as a game! These aren't your Grandma's jelly beans! Beanboozled jelly beans are a mix of some good and also some crazy and gross flavours! Ever tasted rotten egg, mouldy cheese, canned dog food and even pencil shavings flavour? They come in a box with a spinner that helps you decide which ones you'll eat. The Beanboozled Challenge is a fun and daring game if you can stomach it, but of course, the gross factor seems to pull the kids in. Get your camera ready, as you will see their sweet little faces cringe in delight!


8.Bazooka Bubble Gum

Going back to school would not be any fun without a big wad of bubble gum to chew on. What would you stick under your desk? Bazooka Bubblegum still comes with its famous Bazooka Joe comic strip on the inside of every wrapper. You'll always have some new jokes to tell your friends! This gum makes some super huge bubbles... and we've been blowing them with this Retro Bubble Gum since 1947!

 


9. Toxic Waste Hazardously Sour Candy

A hazardously Sour Candy! The perfect candy to help you stay awake during class as you will be jolted with all its intense sour flavour! Kids love sour candy and the small little packages make it easy to stuff your pockets full and then share with all your friends, You'll be the most popular kid in the playground! Toxic Waste also makes High Voltage Bubble Gum so you can also chew on its shockingly cool sour flavour!

 

 

10.Haribo Alphabet Letters

Who knew that learning the alphabet could be so sweet! Now you'll want to eat your words with these mouthwatering, colourful Haribo Gummy Candy. Every letter is full of fresh and fruity flavour, and is made with real fruit juice! Haribo started in the 1920s. An Old Fashioned Candy that is popular all over the world! Haribo makes learning sweet!

Which Back-to-school candy do you think your kids will love the best? Share your thoughts with us on the comments below!
